articles.headline: In Shift From ’08, Holiday Airfare Is Soaring Daily
articles.snippet: Last year’s last-minute deals aren’t likely to be repeated as airlines trim schedules and raise fares.
articles.abstract: Last year’s last-minute deals aren’t likely to be repeated as airlines trim schedules and raise fares.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last year, procrastinators were rewarded when they finally got around to booking flights for holiday travel. Back then, airlines were not prepared for the sharp falloff in travel and offered last-minute deals to fill up empty planes.

articles.headline: Bank of America Chief Forgoes Pay for 2009
articles.snippet: Bowing to increasing scrutiny of his compensation, Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, agreed not to take a salary or bonus for 2009.
articles.abstract: Bowing to increasing scrutiny of his compensation, Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, agreed not to take a salary or bonus for 2009.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bowing to pressure from Washington’s pay czar, Kenneth D. Lewis agreed on Thursday to forgo his salary and bonus as chief executive of Bank of America, as new legal questions emerged about the troubled takeover of Merrill Lynch that led to his downfall.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

articles.headline: Weak Dollar? Not So Much in China
articles.snippet: Despite all the talk, it appears that the dollar is not getting either weaker or stronger.
articles.abstract: Despite all the talk, it appears that the dollar is not getting either weaker or stronger.
articles.lead_paragraph: There is renewed talk about the weak dollar. But don’t believe it.

articles.headline: The Tech Sector Trumpets Signs of a Real Rebound
articles.snippet: Although optimistic, some analysts are still taking a wait-and-see attitude regarding the recovery of companies like I.B.M. and Google.
articles.abstract: Although optimistic, some analysts are still taking a wait-and-see attitude regarding the recovery of companies like I.B.M. and Google.
articles.lead_paragraph: The calendar says we are well on our way to winter, but for many technology companies, orders are starting to bloom like flowers after a spring rain.

articles.headline: E.P.A. Vows Better Effort on Water
articles.snippet: The E.P.A. administrator said the agency was “falling short of this administration’s expectations” for the effectiveness of clean water enforcement.
articles.abstract: The E.P.A. administrator said the agency was “falling short of this administration’s expectations” for the effectiveness of clean water enforcement.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency said on Thursday that it would overhaul enforcement of the Clean Water Act, as lawmakers sharply criticized the agency’s decade-long lapses in punishing polluters.

articles.headline: Acorn’s Woes Strain Its Ties to Democrats
articles.snippet: The group’s relationship with the Democratic Party has always been productive and uneasy.
articles.abstract: The group’s relationship with the Democratic Party has always been productive and uneasy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last December, in one of his last acts as New York City’s top urban development official  and just days before President Obama nominated him as the federal housing secretary  Shaun Donovan attended a groundbreaking ceremony in the South Bronx.

articles.headline: Bonuses Put Goldman in Public Relations Bind
articles.snippet: While most Americans are still waiting for an economic recovery, Goldman and its employees are enjoying one of the richest periods in the bank’s 140-year history
articles.abstract: While most Americans are still waiting for an economic recovery, Goldman and its employees are enjoying one of the richest periods in the bank’s 140-year history
articles.lead_paragraph: A celebrated Goldman Sachs partner, Gus Levy, coined the maxim that long defined the bank, the savviest and most influential firm on Wall Street: “Greedy, but long-term greedy.”

articles.headline: Balloon Ran Away, but Boy, 6, Never Left Home
articles.snippet: A Colorado youngster hid in the attic after a homemade aircraft got loose and drifted 60 miles, setting off an unneeded rescue effort.
articles.abstract: A Colorado youngster hid in the attic after a homemade aircraft got loose and drifted 60 miles, setting off an unneeded rescue effort.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT COLLINS, Colo.  For hours on Thursday, people around the country were gripped by television images of a homemade silver balloon careening through the skies near here, whooshing over fields and trees and yards with a 6-year-old boy believed inside.
articles.byline: By Dan Frosch and Monica Davey

articles.headline: A Mother, a Sick Son and His Father, the Priest
articles.snippet: A rare look at the lengths the Catholic Church goes to keep clergy members’ clandestine relationships hidden.
articles.abstract: A rare look at the lengths the Catholic Church goes to keep clergy members’ clandestine relationships hidden.
articles.lead_paragraph: O’FALLON, Mo.  With three small children and her marriage in trouble, Pat Bond attended a spirituality retreat for Roman Catholic women in Illinois 26 years ago in hopes of finding support and comfort.
